page.title: 12Landscape And Buildings
page.content: { The old mill at Great Ponton} When ,walking down Mill Lane ,we came across the old mill (now a private house).MOst of the old features were still in evidence. Steven Atkin 1m:"On the outside there was a large water wheel,some 12 metres in diameter.Inside there were three floors.On the second floor there was the actual millstone used and all the cogs and wheels,which still turned after 130 years.There were trapdoors on the second and third floors where the sacks of corn were dropped by using chain pulleys.Some of the steps on the ladders were very old and thin.On the top floor there were four holes for storing the different types of corn.Points of interest: 1)The mill was last used in 1950 2)The mill was owned by A.S.Crabtree 3)It employed 4 men in the 19thcent.
